perturbation.original_text: 5.3 The Distributor must pay the full amount invoiced to it by the Supplier in USD$'s within thirty (45) days of the date of invoice.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.3 The Distributor must pay the full amount invoiced to it by the Supplier in USD$'s within fifteen (15) days of the date of invoice.
perturbation.explanation: This change reduces the payment period from 45 days to 15 days. While not universally illegal, such a short payment window could be considered unreasonable and conflict with standard business practices and potentially the implied duty of good faith and fair dealing in some jurisdictions, particularly if the distributor is a small business. This may contradict state-level prompt payment laws that afford more reasonable payment terms.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of implied duty of good faith and fair dealing; possible conflicts with state prompt payment laws.

perturbation.explanation: This modification reduces the notification period for potential product liability claims from five days to one day. This extremely short timeframe could be deemed unreasonable and may violate state laws requiring a reasonable opportunity to investigate claims. Such a short window may be considered procedurally unconscionable, particularly if the distributor needs more time to assess the situation before notifying the supplier.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of state laws related to reasonable notification periods for claims; possible procedural unconscionability.

perturbation.original_text: 11.1 This agreement begins on the Commencement Date and, subject to clause 11.2, shall continue for an initial term of one (1) years (Initial Term) and indefinitely after that until terminated by either party giving at least twelve (12) months' prior written notice to expire on or after the expiry date of the initial term.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.1 This agreement begins on the Commencement Date and, subject to clause 11.2, shall continue for an initial term of one (1) years (Initial Term) and indefinitely after that until terminated by either party giving at least one (1) months' prior written notice to expire on or after the expiry date of the initial term.
perturbation.explanation: The change reduces the required notice period for termination from twelve months to one month. This may conflict with state franchise laws, which often mandate longer notice periods for termination to protect distributors, giving them adequate time to wind down operations and find alternative arrangements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of state franchise laws regarding termination notice periods.
